channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOLR-7530] Wrong JSON response using Terms Component with distrib=true
item.description:
When using TermsComponent in SolrCloud there are differences in the JSON response if parameter distrib is true or false. If distrib=true JSON is not well formed (please note at the [ ] marks)

JSON Response when distrib=false. Correct response:
{"responseHeader":{
"status":0,
"QTime":3
},
"terms":

{ "FileType": [ "EMAIL",20060, "PDF",7051, "IMAGE",5108, "OFFICE",4912, "TXT",4405, "OFFICE_EXCEL",4122, "OFFICE_WORD",2468 ] } }

JSON Response when distrib=true. Incorrect response:
{
"responseHeader":{
"status":0,
"QTime":94
},
"terms":{
"FileType":

{ "EMAIL":31923, "PDF":11545, "IMAGE":9807, "OFFICE_EXCEL":8195, "OFFICE":5147, "OFFICE_WORD":4820, "TIFF":1156, "XML":851, "HTML":821, "RTF":303 }


} }
item.summary: Wrong JSON response using Terms Component with distrib=true

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Facing same issue
On debugging, found that the difference in response format is due how SimpleOrderedMap and NamedList are handled in JSONResponseWriter. This issue occurs only with wt=json

  • In single shard/stand alone mode, terms are accumulated in NamedList and returned. In multiSharding, while handling shardResponses SimpleOrderedMap is used to accumulate terms and counts 
    https://github.com/apache/lucene-solr/blob/master/solr/core/src/java/org/apache/solr/handler/component/TermsComponent.java#L191

    https://github.com/apache/lucene-solr/blob/master/solr/core/src/java/org/apache/solr/handler/component/TermsComponent.java#L557
  • Also, response formats are different when terms list specified and when no terms list is specified. This is also due to difference SimpleOrderedMap vs NamedList handling
Probable Solutions:
  • Instead of NamedList, use SimpleOrderedMap. Problem is that it won't be backward compatible. Also, facet response and terms response would be different. SOLR-1845
  • Use of NamedList in place of SimpleOrderedMap. If I'm not wrong, SimpleOrderedMap is preferred over NamedList in recent times. This would be step backward but will solve this issue

Let me know what would be best approach to handle this. I'm willing to raise a patch for this

Some more observation

  • Modified termsComponent to use NamedList wherever required, but this made the response ugly when terms.ttf=true 
    {
  "type_s": [
    "review",
    {
      "df": 8,
      "ttf": 0
    },
    "book",
    {
      "df": 4,
      "ttf": 0
    },
    "comment",
    {
      "df": 4,
      "ttf": 0
    }
  ],
  "id": [
    "book4",
    {
      "df": 1,
      "ttf": 0
    },
    "book4_c1",
    {
      "df": 1,
      "ttf": 0
    },
    "book4_c2",
    {
      "df": 1,
      "ttf": 0
    },
    "book4_c3",
    {
      "df": 1,
      "ttf": 0
    },
    "book5",
    {
      "df": 1,
      "ttf": 0
    },
    "book5_c1",
    {
      "df": 1,
      "ttf": 0
    },
    "book5_c2",
    {
      "df": 1,
      "ttf": 0
    },
    "book5_c3",
    {
      "df": 1,
      "ttf": 0
    },
    "book6",
    {
      "df": 1,
      "ttf": 0
    },
    "book6_c1",
    {
      "df": 1,
      "ttf": 0
    }
  ]
}
  • Also, indexstats response uses SimpleOrderedMap in both standalone and multishard

I feel it is better to use SimpleOrderedMap in all cases but downside is fix would be available only in 9x as this breaks backward compatibility.

Found an issue with terms.ttf, I have created separate JIRA for this SOLR-13333

I'd like to commit array "FileType": [ "EMAIL",20060,... format into master (9x) for both distrib&non-distrib modes. UPD ok. I've got that we can't do that right now.

Personally I prefer object "FileType": { "EMAIL":20060,.., but array is consistent with old facets. Right? Please confirm my understanding.
ok. Let's introduce an optional parameter terms.format=9.0, which will be always set at >= 9.0.

I'd like to commit array "FileType": [ "EMAIL",20060,... format into master (9x) for both distrib&non-distrib modes. UPD ok. I've got that we can't do that right now.

Personally I prefer object "FileType": { "EMAIL":20060,.., but array is consistent with old facets. Right? Please confirm my understanding.

Even though it won't be consistent with old facets response, I prefer current format returned in distributed mode. With NamedList response would look like this when terms.ttf=true which I feel kind of ugly.
If we are going with old facets response format, should df-ttf response block also be changed to NamedList?

ok. Let's introduce an optional parameter terms.format=9.0, which will be always set at >= 9.0.

Do we need this parameter? If this issue is committed only to master then we won't require above parameter right?

Hi, munendrasn, thanks for your explanation.

  1. Note, I barely understand NamedList vs SimpleOrderMap as terminology, let's talk about array vs object in json.
  2. If we consider array format. I wouldn't say ttf makes it more ugly. eg {{ "FileType": [ "EMAIL",20060,..]}} is equally odd/ugly/reasonable than {{"FileType": [ "EMAIL", {"df":8,"ttf":1}

    , "TEXT",

    {"df":7,"ttf":2}

    , ...]}}.
    bw. If this issue is committed only to master then we won't require above parameter right?
    Indeed. Absolutely. Good catch!

mkhludnev

f we consider array format. I wouldn't say ttf makes it more ugly. eg {{ "FileType": [ "EMAIL",20060,..]}} is equally odd/ugly/reasonable than {{"FileType": [ "EMAIL",

Unknown macro: {"df"}

, "TEXT",

Unknown macro: {"df"}

So, Fieldtype response would be an array and when terms.ttf=true then, values would be object

{
  "type_s": [
    "review",
    {

    },

      "df": 1,

    },
    "book5_c2",
    {
      "df": 1,

    },

    {

    },
    "book6_c1",
    {
      "df": 1,
      "ttf": 0
    }
  ]
}

and when terms.ttf=false, then response would be 

{
  "type_s": [
    "review",
    8,
    "book",
    4,
    "comment",
    4
  ],
  "id": [
    "book4",
    1,
    "book4_c1",
    1,
    "book4_c2",
    1,
    "book4_c3",
    1,
    "book5",
    1
  ]
}

Is my understanding correct??
Once you confirm and SOLR-13333 is resolved(just trying to avoid rebasing), I will pick this up. Hope, that is okay
munendrasn, you are welcome! SOLR-13333 is done.

SOLR-7530.patch
Patch based on this comment

SOLR-7530.patch

  • Correct me if my understanding is wrong, changes in the Distrib test is to validate parsed response returned by server. I have made minor changes so that it validates not only JSON but javabin and xml response formats too. This could probably be improved further. Also, this should be moved as part of base test case
  • I have changed the wordings a bit in CHANGES.txt, based on SOLR-1845. Should the reason for choosing Namedlist(array) over SimpleOrderMap(Object/map) be mentioned here??
  • Also, test failure above doesn't look like related to this change

1. I feel like javabin is covered by super.query(setDistribParams, p); already. And, I've thought issue has place only in json format. But it's ok. Let's have response parser loop.
  2. I think we can create response parsers in the method as it's initialized now, since I don't know whether they are stateless
  3. regarding CHANGES.txt entry. I'm not sure that claiming consistency is enough to warn potentially impacted users about breaking compatibility, that's why I put array term before as more explicit.

-1 overall

Commit 4f6314c59bf0830da2c99c6a820f4a3e2acb532a in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/master from Mikhail Khludnev
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=4f6314c ]

SOLR-7530: /terms responds per field arrays in JSON by default

mkhludnev
SOLR-7530.patch
I have updated the documentation to add JSON example when terms.ttf=true. Also, note about terms.list. I have not included some bugs/limitation which are in progress. Please suggest if any changes required

While updating this, observed that when terms.ttf=true, the value returned is long but when terms.ttf=false the value returned is integer in standalone mode but it could be integer or long in distributed based on the value. Currently, value type varies b/w standalone and distributed mode in other components too but here(terms), I feel slightly more inconsistent as terms.ttf value affects the type and based on actual value type varies in distributed mode. For now, I have left it as it is

+1 overall
